title: Pre season frame rate.
body: As the new pre-season just came I wanted to check in with everyone else and see how their frame rate is doing. My frame rate was a solid 60 when I was playing yesterday, But as I just now updated and started playing. My frames keep dropping to 20-30 I wanted to know if anyone else is having these kinds of issues and if anyone know's how to go about and fixing this.

replies.body:
Do you happen to be running Windows 10? If so, there happened to be a batch of Windows 10 updates that went out last night that *may* have re-enabled the *Windows Game Bar* if you previously had it disabled. This feature has been causing severe FPS issues and computer crashes for some players. I'd recommend [disabling this feature](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) entirely to see if it resolves your issue.

Let me know if this helped.

Thankfully I don't have window's 10, I run the game on window's 8.1 and was playing League just a hour before the patch just fine with a solid 60 fps.  Now it's dropping frames to like 20-30 fps and in team fights it just drops down to 7 fps. I don't have a real reason for this as I've done nothing different to my computer in the time it took me to get the patch.

It's a good thing you're not plagued by that issue. I think it's safe to say this is likely caused by the other common culprits, which are either display driver issues or hardware problems. We can investigate this by having you work through all the solutions listed in our [FPS troubleshooting guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting)

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

Same issue here, although I changed some stuff. Still the combinations don't make sense, there is definitely something wrong:


Situation 1:

- Windows 7
- Overwolf _enabled_
- 100 fps

Situation 2:

- Windows 10
- GameDVR _enabled_ (the MS recording thingy)
- Overwolf _enabled_
-  40 fps

Situation 3:

- Windows 10
- GameDVR _disabled_
- Overwolf _enabled_
-  50 fps

Situation 4:

- Windows 10
- GameDVR _disabled_
- Overwolf _disabled_
-  100 fps

For some reason, Windows 10 doesn't play well with recorders...
